title: India
summary: India, also known as the Republic of India is a country in South Asia. It is the seventh largest country by area with more than 1.3 billion people. It is the second most populous country as well as the most populous democracy in the world.

value.label: The Indus Valley Civilisation was the first urban culture in South Asia.

In the 6th and 7th centuries, the first devotional hymns were created in the Tamil language. They were imitated all over India and led to both the resurgence of Hinduism and the development of all modern languages of the subcontinent.

The relative peace maintained by the Mughal Empire during much of the 17th century was a factor in India's economic expansion. By the early 18th century a number of European trading companies had established coastal outposts.
The Indian Rebellion of 1857 led to the dissolution of the East India Company and the direct administration of India by the British government.

sections.title: Government
sections.label: India has a parliamentary republic with a multi-party system.
